Class ConflationEvent<E extends IEfsEvent>

java.lang.Object
org.efs.event.ConflationEvent<E>
Type Parameters:
E - encapsulated event type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
IEfsEvent
public final class ConflationEvent<E extends IEfsEvent> extends Object implements IEfsEvent
This mutable event allows changing the encapsulated event instance even when this ConflationEvent is posted to an agent event queue. This means that the agent received only the latest event when removed from the event queue.

A ConflationEvent instance is generally created at start up and re-used with a given "primary key" based on the encapsulated event. The idea is that the code dispatching the encapsulated event looks up the associated conflation event based on the encapsulated event's primary key and calls offer(IEfsEvent).

Author:
Charles W. Rapp

    Creates a new conflation event with no encapsulated event.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConflationEvent

      public ConflationEvent()
      Creates a new conflation event with no encapsulated event.

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this conflation event does not contain an encapsulated event and false if it does.
      Returns:
      true if there is no encapsulated event.
      See Also:
      • contains(Class)
      • offer(E)

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Class<?> clazz)
      Return true if this conflation event is not empty and the contained event is a class which is assignable from the given class.
      Parameters:
      clazz - check if non-null encapsulated event is assignable from this class.
      Returns:
      true if this conflation event contains a non-null event assignable from clazz.

    • peek

      @Nullable public E peek()
      Returns latest event contained in this conflation event without removing this latest event. May return null if there is no contained event.
      Returns:
      latest event but does not remove it from conflation event.
      See Also:
      • poll()
      • offer(IEfsEvent)

    • poll

      @Nullable public E poll()
      Returns latest event contained in this conflation event. May return null if there is no contained event.
      Returns:
      latest encapsulated event.
      See Also:
      • peek()
      • offer(IEfsEvent)

    • currentMissedEventCount

      public int currentMissedEventCount()
      Returns number of missed events between initial offer(IEfsEvent) and before poll(). Note that this value is reset to zero when poll() is called.
      Returns:
      number of currently missed events.

    • missedEventCount

      public int missedEventCount()
      Returns missed count set after the most recent poll. If no poll has yet been performed, then returns zero.
      Returns:
      missed event count.

    • offer

      public boolean offer(E event)
      Sets encapsulate event and returns true if encapsulated event was initially null and false otherwise. If true is returned, then this ConflationEvent should be dispatched to the agent event queue because this conflation event is currently not enqueued.
      Parameters:
      event - encapsulated event.
      Returns:
      true if this ConflationEvent needs to be added to the agent event queue and false if this conflation event is already enqueued.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if event is null.
